The claim originated from an article on: com, a website founded by Will Johnson, who has expressed opposition to Black Lives Matter and has been invited to the White House by President Donald Trump.
The alleged rules for white protesters w: including a screenshot of a tweet from an account that promotes pro-Trump views and has criticized Black Lives Matter.
Black Lives Matter Global Network: the official organization covering the US, Canada, and UK, denied issuing any rules for white protesters. Kailee Scales, the managing director, confirmed this in an email response to AFP.
The misinformation regarding the rules h: with social media posts linking them to Black Lives Matter Melbourne in Australia and a British-based conspiracy theorist claiming they originated there. However, the organizers of a Melbourne protest in support of Black Lives Matter did not mention any such rules on their Facebook page.
